climbs.name: The Winged Horse
climbs.fa: 17 November 1970 by Fred Beckey and Jack Miller

content.description: The climb begins at the center of the face near a large (wide) pine tree.  One pitch of face and crack up and left (5.8) to an obvious corner.  Two more pitches of aid and free climbing lead to face climbing protected by chickenheads and a chimney system to the summit.  Reference:  Secor, The High Sierra, 3rd ed., pg 81.
content.protection: Standard Sierra Alpine Rack with aiders and hooks
content.location: From the summit, one rappel west into the Impala-Springbok gully, then scramble down the gully until you can traverse back to the start.

climbs.name: Adios Yahoos
climbs.fa: June 2007 by Matt Compton, SP Parker, and Chris Simmons

content.description: From the pine tree marking the started of The Winged Horse, traverse left approximately 100' until cracks can be seen leading to the lower left corner of the scimitar-shaped roof.  Pitch 1:  Climb cracks to a ledge immediately to the left of the scimitar-shaped roof.  Pitch 2:  Traverse the roof to the opposite corner.  Pitch 3 & 4:  Climb cracks directly to the summit.
content.location: Follow descent directions for The Winged Horse.
